programme.title: Torque
programme.desc: Framed for murder by a drug dealer, a biker (Martin Henderson) must elude lawmen and the brother (Ice Cube) of the dead man.

programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Two military madmen (Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey) hijack a nuclear-armed Navy battleship with a SEAL commando (Steven Seagal) on board as a cook.

programme.title: Deep Cover
programme.desc: An undercover officer (Larry Fishburne) hooks up with a lawyer (Jeff Goldblum) who deals drugs for a West Coast cartel run by a foreign diplomat.

programme.title: Joshua
programme.desc: Men who return home from the Civil War with hopes of rebuilding their lives find death and destruction.

programme.title: Velvet Smooth
programme.desc: A crime lord hires Velvet Smooth (Johnnie Hill), the head of a detective agency, to find out who is stealing his business.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Guest host Melba Moore. Aaron Hall and Cherrelle sing. Comedy by Terry Hodges.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Guest host Lisa Stansfield, Chris Walker sings; comedy by Angel Salazar and Yvette Wilson.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Host: Lisa Fischer; MC Lyte; comics Lewis Dix Jr., Mark Curry.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Host Dawnn Lewis; Alyson Williams; Pete Rock & C.L. Smooth; comic J.B. Smooth.

programme.title: What Would You Do for Love?
programme.desc: A fitness trainer who was living paycheck to paycheck decides to keep his new multimillionaire status a secret when he goes on a dating blitz to find true love in 30 days or less.

programme.title: Where's the Love?
programme.desc: Two relationship experts (Lamman Rucker, Denise Boutt√©) try to keep up appearances when their own marriage begins to falter.

programme.title: My First Love
programme.desc: A man's refusal to monitor his use of electronic devices plays a major role in his troubled marriage.

programme.title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.sub-title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.desc: Recorded in 1993 at the Blue Note Jazz Club in New York City, this performance by Chaka Khan features a number of songs closely associated with jazz.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Laura is suing DJ for $3,000 for harassment; DJ is countersuing Laura for $3,000 for harassment.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Matthew is suing his roommate Elliot for stealing his food deliveries and never reimbursing him for his share of the bills; Elliot claims they always had an arrangement where they share everything.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Maggie was forced to rent a hotel room for a month after her childhood friend, Darla, backpedaled on her offer to allow Maggie to live with her; Darla claims Maggie committed an unforgivable offense back home but has yet to explain.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: The unsolved murder of Yosbel Millares.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.sub-title: Security Guard Shot in the Back
programme.desc: The unsolved murders of Antoine Alexander and Iverson Wilson.

programme.title: Class Act
programme.desc: Two disparate high-school newcomers (Christopher Reid, Christopher Martin) trade places, find girlfriends and don't want to trade back.

programme.title: Who's the Man?
programme.desc: Two Harlem barbers (Ed Lover, Andre Romelle Young) score well on a multiple-choice police exam and use their badges to expose a ruthless developer.
